an5.139:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo akkhamo hoti rūpānaṁ, akkhamo saddānaṁ, akkhamo gandhānaṁ, akkhamo rasānaṁ, akkhamo phoṭṭhabbānaṁ.
an5.139:1.3.en: It’s when a royal bull elephant can’t endure sights, sounds, smells, tastes, and touches.

an5.139:2.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo akkhamo hoti rūpānaṁ?
an5.139:2.1.en: And how is it that a royal bull elephant can’t endure sights?

an5.139:2.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo akkhamo hoti rūpānaṁ.
an5.139:2.3.en: That’s how a royal bull elephant can’t endure sights.

an5.139:3.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo akkhamo hoti saddānaṁ?
an5.139:3.1.en: And how is it that a royal bull elephant can’t endure sounds?

an5.139:3.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo akkhamo hoti saddānaṁ.
an5.139:3.3.en: That’s how a royal bull elephant can’t endure sounds.

an5.139:4.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo akkhamo hoti gandhānaṁ?
an5.139:4.1.en: And how is it that a royal bull elephant can’t endure smells?

an5.139:4.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo akkhamo hoti gandhānaṁ.
an5.139:4.3.en: That’s how a royal bull elephant can’t endure smells.

an5.139:5.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo akkhamo hoti rasānaṁ?
an5.139:5.1.en: And how is it that a royal bull elephant can’t endure tastes?

an5.139:5.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo akkhamo hoti rasānaṁ.
an5.139:5.3.en: That’s how a royal bull elephant can’t endure tastes.

an5.139:6.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo akkhamo hoti phoṭṭhabbānaṁ?
an5.139:6.1.en: And how is it that a royal bull elephant can’t endure touches?

an5.139:6.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo akkhamo hoti phoṭṭhabbānaṁ.
an5.139:6.3.en: That’s how a royal bull elephant can’t endure touches.

an5.139:8.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu akkhamo hoti rūpānaṁ, akkhamo saddānaṁ, akkhamo gandhānaṁ, akkhamo rasānaṁ, akkhamo phoṭṭhabbānaṁ.
an5.139:8.3.en: It’s when a mendicant can’t endure sights, sounds, smells, tastes, and touches.

an5.139:9.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu akkhamo hoti rūpānaṁ?
an5.139:9.1.en: And how is it that a mendicant can’t endure sights?

an5.139:9.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu akkhamo hoti rūpānaṁ.
an5.139:9.3.en: That’s how a mendicant can’t endure sights.

an5.139:10.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu akkhamo hoti saddānaṁ?
an5.139:10.1.en: And how is it that a mendicant can’t endure sounds?

an5.139:10.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu akkhamo hoti saddānaṁ.
an5.139:10.3.en: That’s how a mendicant can’t endure sounds.

an5.139:11.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu akkhamo hoti gandhānaṁ?
an5.139:11.1.en: And how is it that a mendicant can’t endure smells?

an5.139:11.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu akkhamo hoti gandhānaṁ.
an5.139:11.3.en: That’s how a mendicant can’t endure smells.

an5.139:12.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu akkhamo hoti rasānaṁ?
an5.139:12.1.en: And how is it that a mendicant can’t endure tastes?

an5.139:12.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu akkhamo hoti rasānaṁ.
an5.139:12.3.en: That’s how a mendicant can’t endure tastes.

an5.139:13.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu akkhamo hoti phoṭṭhabbānaṁ?
an5.139:13.1.en: And how is it that a mendicant can’t endure touches?

an5.139:13.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu akkhamo hoti phoṭṭhabbānaṁ.
an5.139:13.3.en: That’s how a mendicant can’t endure touches.

an5.139:15.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo khamo hoti rūpānaṁ, khamo saddānaṁ, khamo gandhānaṁ, khamo rasānaṁ, khamo phoṭṭhabbānaṁ.
an5.139:15.3.en: It’s when a royal bull elephant can endure sights, sounds, smells, tastes, and touches.

an5.139:16.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo khamo hoti rūpānaṁ?
an5.139:16.1.en: And how is it that a royal bull elephant can endure sights?

an5.139:16.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo khamo hoti rūpānaṁ.
an5.139:16.3.en: That’s how a royal bull elephant can endure sights.

an5.139:17.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo khamo hoti saddānaṁ?
an5.139:17.1.en: And how is it that a royal bull elephant can endure sounds?

an5.139:17.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo khamo hoti saddānaṁ.
an5.139:17.3.en: That’s how a royal bull elephant can endure sounds.

an5.139:18.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo khamo hoti gandhānaṁ?
an5.139:18.1.en: And how is it that a royal bull elephant can endure smells?

an5.139:18.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo khamo hoti gandhānaṁ.
an5.139:18.3.en: That’s how a royal bull elephant can endure smells.

an5.139:19.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo khamo hoti rasānaṁ?
an5.139:19.1.en: And how is it that a royal bull elephant can endure tastes?

an5.139:19.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo khamo hoti rasānaṁ.
an5.139:19.3.en: That’s how a royal bull elephant can endure tastes.

an5.139:20.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo khamo hoti phoṭṭhabbānaṁ?
an5.139:20.1.en: And how is it that a royal bull elephant can endure touches?

an5.139:20.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo khamo hoti phoṭṭhabbānaṁ.
an5.139:20.3.en: That’s how a royal bull elephant can endure touches.

an5.139:22.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu khamo hoti rūpānaṁ, khamo saddānaṁ, khamo gandhānaṁ, khamo rasānaṁ, khamo phoṭṭhabbānaṁ.
an5.139:22.3.en: It’s when a mendicant can endure sights, sounds, smells, tastes, and touches.

an5.139:23.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu khamo hoti rūpānaṁ?
an5.139:23.1.en: And how is it that a mendicant can endure sights?

an5.139:23.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu khamo hoti rūpānaṁ.
an5.139:23.3.en: That’s how a mendicant can endure sights.

an5.139:24.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu khamo hoti saddānaṁ?
an5.139:24.1.en: And how is it that a mendicant can endure sounds?

an5.139:24.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu khamo hoti saddānaṁ.
an5.139:24.3.en: That’s how a mendicant can endure sounds.

an5.139:25.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu khamo hoti gandhānaṁ.
an5.139:25.1.en: And how is it that a mendicant can endure smells?

an5.139:25.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu khamo hoti gandhānaṁ.
an5.139:25.3.en: That’s how a mendicant can endure smells.

an5.139:26.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu khamo hoti rasānaṁ?
an5.139:26.1.en: And how is it that a mendicant can endure tastes?

an5.139:26.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu khamo hoti rasānaṁ.
an5.139:26.3.en: That’s how a mendicant can endure tastes.

an5.139:27.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu khamo hoti phoṭṭhabbānaṁ?
an5.139:27.1.en: And how is it that a mendicant can endure touches?

an5.139:27.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu khamo hoti phoṭṭhabbānaṁ.
an5.139:27.3.en: That’s how a mendicant can endure touches.

an5.85:1.3.pli: Akkhamo hoti rūpānaṁ, akkhamo saddānaṁ, akkhamo gandhānaṁ, akkhamo rasānaṁ, akkhamo phoṭṭhabbānaṁ—
an5.85:1.3.en: They can’t endure sights, sounds, smells, tastes, and touches.

an5.85:2.3.pli: Khamo hoti rūpānaṁ, khamo saddānaṁ, khamo gandhānaṁ, khamo rasānaṁ, khamo phoṭṭhabbānaṁ—
an5.85:2.3.en: They can endure sights, sounds, smells, tastes, and touches.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 5
9. Senior Mendicants
85. Cannot Endure

an5.113:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu akkhamo hoti rūpānaṁ, akkhamo saddānaṁ, akkhamo gandhānaṁ, akkhamo rasānaṁ, akkhamo phoṭṭhabbānaṁ.
an5.113:1.3.en: It’s when a mendicant can’t endure sights, sounds, smells, tastes, and touches.

an5.113:2.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu khamo hoti rūpānaṁ, khamo saddānaṁ, khamo gandhānaṁ, khamo rasānaṁ, khamo phoṭṭhabbānaṁ.
an5.113:2.3.en: It’s when a mendicant can endure sights, sounds, smells, tastes, and touches.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 5
12. At Andhakavinda
113. Right Immersion

an5.123:1.3.pli: Asappāyakārī hoti, sappāye mattaṁ na jānāti, bhesajjaṁ nappaṭisevitā hoti, atthakāmassa gilānupaṭṭhākassa na yathābhūtaṁ ābādhaṁ āvikattā hoti abhikkamantaṁ vā abhikkamatīti paṭikkamantaṁ vā paṭikkamatīti ṭhitaṁ vā ṭhitoti, uppannānaṁ sārīrikānaṁ vedanānaṁ dukkhānaṁ tibbānaṁ kharānaṁ kaṭukānaṁ asātānaṁ amanāpānaṁ pāṇaharānaṁ anadhivāsakajātiko hoti.
an5.123:1.3.en: They do what is unsuitable. They don’t know moderation in what is suitable. They don’t take their medicine. Though their carer wants what’s best for them, they don’t accurately report their symptoms by saying when they’re getting worse, getting better, or staying the same. And they cannot endure physical pain—sharp, severe, acute, unpleasant, disagreeable, and life-threatening.

an5.123:2.3.pli: Sappāyakārī hoti, sappāye mattaṁ jānāti, bhesajjaṁ paṭisevitā hoti, atthakāmassa gilānupaṭṭhākassa yathābhūtaṁ ābādhaṁ āvikattā hoti abhikkamantaṁ vā abhikkamatīti paṭikkamantaṁ vā paṭikkamatīti ṭhitaṁ vā ṭhitoti, uppannānaṁ sārīrikānaṁ vedanānaṁ dukkhānaṁ tibbānaṁ kharānaṁ kaṭukānaṁ asātānaṁ amanāpānaṁ pāṇaharānaṁ adhivāsakajātiko hoti.
an5.123:2.3.en: They do what is suitable. They know moderation in what is suitable. They take their medicine. Because their carer wants what’s best for them, they accurately report their symptoms by saying when they’re getting worse, getting better, or staying the same. And they can endure physical pain—sharp, severe, acute, unpleasant, disagreeable, and life-threatening.

an6.5:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, rañño bhadro assājānīyo khamo hoti rūpānaṁ, khamo saddānaṁ, khamo gandhānaṁ, khamo rasānaṁ, khamo phoṭṭhabbānaṁ, vaṇṇasampanno ca hoti.
an6.5:2.2.en: It’s when a fine royal thoroughbred can endure sights, sounds, smells, tastes, and touches. And it’s beautiful.

an6.5:3.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu khamo hoti rūpānaṁ, khamo saddānaṁ, khamo gandhānaṁ, khamo rasānaṁ, khamo phoṭṭhabbānaṁ, khamo dhammānaṁ.
an6.5:3.3.en: It’s when a mendicant can endure sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and thoughts.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 6
1. Worthy of Offerings
5. The Thoroughbred (1st)

an6.6:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, rañño bhadro assājānīyo khamo hoti rūpānaṁ, khamo saddānaṁ, khamo gandhānaṁ, khamo rasānaṁ, khamo phoṭṭhabbānaṁ, balasampanno ca hoti.
an6.6:1.3.en: It’s when a fine royal thoroughbred can endure sights, sounds, smells, tastes, and touches. And it’s strong.

an6.6:2.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu khamo hoti rūpānaṁ …pe… khamo dhammānaṁ.
an6.6:2.3.en: It’s when a mendicant can endure sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and thoughts.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 6
1. Worthy of Offerings
6. The Thoroughbred (2nd)

an6.7:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, rañño bhadro assājānīyo khamo hoti rūpānaṁ, khamo saddānaṁ, khamo gandhānaṁ, khamo rasānaṁ, khamo phoṭṭhabbānaṁ, javasampanno ca hoti.
an6.7:1.3.en: It’s when a fine royal thoroughbred can endure sights, sounds, smells, tastes, and touches. And it’s fast.

an6.7:2.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu khamo hoti rūpānaṁ …pe… khamo dhammānaṁ.
an6.7:2.3.en: It’s when a mendicant can endure sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and thoughts.
